result.execSummary:
The defendant Mitchell L. ANWASH was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Under the Huber Law.  Court authorizes release for counseling purposes and authorizes transfer to Ozaukee County Jail as long as Ozaukee County follows Manitowoc County's jail rules.
Under the Huber Law, concurrent with the sentence imposed on count 1.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mitchell L. ANWASH

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: From Dr. Mark Powless regarding AODA treatment.

ADDRESS INFO for Mitchell L. ANWASH
Current: 1332 N. 40th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53208 United States  (Effective: 07-09-2015)
Prior: 1011 12th Avenue, Green Bay, WI 54304

On count 1, possess THC, the defendant is sentenced to the Manitowoc County Jail for sixty (60) days, under the Huber Law, commencing on 08-08-15 by 5:00 p.m.  Court authorizes release for counseling purposes and authorizes transfer to Ozaukee County Jail as long as Ozaukee County follows Manitowoc Countys jail rules.
On count 2, possess drug paraphernalia, the defendant is sentenced to the Manitowoc County Jail for thirty (30) days, under the Huber Law, concurrent with count 1.
The defendant has credit for 3 days.
The court imposes $323.00 court costs, to be paid by 09-09-15 or 6 days county jail for failure to pay.
Minutes.

The State moves to amend count 1 to misdemeanor possess THC.  Motion granted.
GUILTY pleas entered to counts 1 and 2, possess THC and possess drug paraphernalia.  Convicted.
The State moves to dismiss and read in count 3, carry concealed weapon.  Motion granted.
Sentencing is set for 07-09-15 at 9:30 a.m.
Minutes.

Defense requests an adjournment.  The defendant is entering a treatment program which was part of the State's offer.
Plea date is reset to 05-20-15 at 9:30 a.m.
Minutes.

Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 1 for further proceedings.  Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing. 
ARRAIGNMENT
Information filed.  Not guilty pleas.  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 02-06-15 at 1:30 p.m.  Plea date is set for 03-26-15 at 2:00 p.m.  State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.   
Minutes.

Defendant requests counsel and is referred to the public defender.  Initial appearance is reset to 01-05-15 at 2:30 p.m.  
Notice.
Initial appearance is reset to 12-22-14 at 2:30 p.m.
Initial appearance is reset to 12-15-14 at 2:30 p.m.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of possess THC-2nd offense, carry concealed weapon and possess drug paraphernalia.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 12-08-14 at 2:30 p.m. Bail is set at $1,700.00 recognizance bond with the condition that she maintain absolute sobriety. Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Probable Cause Statement and Judicial Determination.
Minutes.
